answers.answer: Hi!Well, yes, the risk of vaginal infections especially thrush or fungal infection is higher in women on contraceptive pills containing estrogen. Changing the pill type often helps in these cases. Yeast infection or thrush is at times very difficult to treat. You may need to take oral antifungal pills twice a week for 3-4 weeks along with local application of antifungal cream. Antifungal with a combination of two or more anti fungals is more effective. At times both partners need to be treated. However, these are strong medicines, and please do not take without consulting your gynecologist who would first confirm that it is indeed fungal infection.Various reasons for recurrent fungal infection are incomplete treatment, treatment resistance, co-existing dermatitis, diabetes and low immunity. Discuss this with your gynecologist. Take care!
